emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Development Environment
emerging_technologies.description: An advanced AI system that not only completes code but also autonomously designs, writes, and deploys software applications, integrating with version control systems for seamless collaboration.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the need for large development teams, increases software quality and efficiency, but raises concerns about job displacement and the need for new skill sets.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High adoption in tech hubs due to productivity gains; slower adoption in sectors requiring human creativity or where regulation is stringent.

emerging_technologies.name: Neuromorphic Computing Chips
emerging_technologies.description: Chips designed to mimic the neural structure and operation of the human brain, significantly improving AI's efficiency and energy use.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enables more sophisticated AI applications, potentially revolutionizing fields like autonomous driving and personal assistants, with ethical considerations around AI's role in decision making.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption will be driven by energy efficiency demands and the push for real-time AI processing capabilities.

emerging_technologies.name: Space-Based Solar Power
emerging_technologies.description: Satellites that capture solar energy in space, where sunlight is uninterrupted, and beam it back to Earth as microwave or laser energy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for near-limitless clean energy, but with high initial costs and geopolitical implications regarding space ownership and energy distribution.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Initial adoption by nations with strong space programs; widespread adoption depends on cost reduction and international cooperation.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain for Digital Identity
mainstream_technologies.description: Use of blockchain technology to create secure, verifiable digital identities for individuals, reducing identity theft and enhancing online privacy.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in digital services, e-commerce, and by governments for managing citizen data securely.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI in Health Diagnostics
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems capable of diagnosing diseases from medical images with accuracy surpassing human experts.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Integrated into healthcare systems globally, with ongoing training and updates to adapt to new medical data.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems that automate cognitive tasks traditionally performed by humans.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Significant changes in employment sectors, requiring retraining and education shifts. Enhances quality of life by reducing mundane tasks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for AI ethics, regulation, and education reform to adapt to AI-driven work environments.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on technologies that reduce environmental impact and increase energy efficiency.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes global sustainability efforts, potentially reducing energy poverty, but also creates new forms of economic disparity.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased international collaboration on climate change, with a focus on renewable energy innovations.
